about_section_desc: Real Estate Group specializes in the sale of detached houses, maisonettes, rental rooms, hotels, villas, and commercial properties, in collaboration with experienced architects, civil engineers, and the best local craftsmen. Our twenty years of experience in buying and selling our own and other properties offers our clients the ideal guarantee of quality services. We undertake the sale of your property or the construction of your home with consistency, speed, and, above all, reliability! Our company's team includes experienced architects and civil engineers, as well as the best local craftsmen active in the area. Our company is housed in a privately owned building in Nea Vrasna. The buying and selling process is conducted with absolute confidentiality, in cooperation with local surveyors, and with a lawyer who speaks Greek, English, and Bulgarian. His goal, for clients from abroad, is to ensure they are legally informed and confident about the purchase they are making before the contract is signed. Our aim is the correct and swift completion of the transaction process, with the primary concern being the satisfaction of our client.
faq1_question: What is the process for buying a property?
faq1_answer: The process begins with finding the right property, followed by legal and technical inspections, the signing of the preliminary agreement, and finally, the signing of the final contract at the notary's office.
faq2_question: What documents are needed for a sale?
faq2_answer: For a sale, you need title deeds, a tax clearance certificate, an energy performance certificate, an engineer's certificate of no unauthorized constructions, and other documents depending on the case.
faq3_answer: Yes, we provide comprehensive management services for short-term rental properties, from promotion and bookings to cleaning and maintenance.
faq_intro_text: Buying a property is a major decision. We understand you have questions, so we've gathered clear and honest answers to help you understand the process and make informed decisions every step of the way.
faq4_question: Is a lawyer mandatory in real estate transactions?
faq4_answer: No, since 2014, a lawyer is not mandatory for signing a contract. However, legal advice is strongly recommended to protect your interests.
faq5_question: What kind of permit is required for construction or renovation?
faq5_answer: A building permit is required for construction. For renovations, depending on the extent of the work, a small-scale permit, work approval, or a full building permit may be needed.
faq6_answer: The Building ID is an electronic file that contains all the details of a building (permits, plans, legality). It is mandatory for any property transfer.
faq7_question: Do I need to declare a renovation to the authorities?
faq7_answer: Yes, most renovation work requires some form of declaration or permit from the relevant municipality or planning office, depending on the size and type of work.
faq8_question: What applies to unauthorized constructions or modifications?
faq8_answer: Unauthorized constructions must be legalized or demolished. There are various legalization procedures involving the payment of fines, depending on the date and nature of the unauthorized work.
faq9_question: Documents for Selling or Constructing a Property
faq9_answer: For a sale, you need titles, tax clearance, ENFIA certificate, energy certificate, and an engineer's certificate. For construction, a topographical survey, architectural plans, structural study, etc., are required.
faq10_answer: Masonry buildings are traditional constructions with load-bearing walls. Prefabricated buildings are manufactured off-site and assembled on-site, offering speed and economy.
faq11_answer: Real estate agencies handle the finding, promotion, and negotiation of properties, providing specialized services to buyers and sellers.
